text.text: An amazing way to see Singapore from above—absolutely worth it. The panoramic views from the top are simply breathtaking. A peaceful ride with stunning sights of Marina Bay and the city skyline.A perfect sunset ride—calm, romantic, and unforgettable. If you're visiting Singapore for the first time, the Flyer is a must. The views are completely next level. In some cute & short words it's like One ride, endless views. Loved every minute. I completely recommend Singapore Flyer, It's surrounding view, Technology, Landscaping, Infrastructure, Architecture & everything almost all the matter.

The views are completely next level. In some cute & short words it's like One ride, endless views. Loved every minute. I completely recommend Singapore Flyer, It's surrounding view, Technology, Landscaping, Infrastructure, Architecture & everything almost all the matter.

text.text:
A must-visit spot — truly beautiful and popular for a reason!
The scenery is stunning, with plenty of photo opportunities in every corner. It’s a well-known place, so it can get a bit crowded, but the atmosphere and views definitely make it worth it. Great for both sightseeing and relaxing

originalText.text:
A must-visit spot — truly beautiful and popular for a reason!
The scenery is stunning, with plenty of photo opportunities in every corner. It’s a well-known place, so it can get a bit crowded, but the atmosphere and views definitely make it worth it. Great for both sightseeing and relaxing

text.text: The 30-minute ride on the Singapore Cable Car is so relaxing, with plenty of space inside the capsules to sit back and enjoy the views. I highly recommend going around sunset, as you’ll get to witness the magical transition from day to night. It’s a wonderful experience where you can take in the breathtaking city views from above—absolutely perfect for a serene moment during your trip.

It’s a wonderful experience where you can take in the breathtaking city views from above—absolutely perfect for a serene moment during your trip.

text.text:
The Singapore Flyer is one of the world's largest observation wheels, located in Singapore's Marina Bay area. Here are some key details:

Key Facts:

Height: 165 meters (541 feet)

Opened: 2008

Location: Marina Bay, Singapore

Duration of Ride: About 30 minutes for one full rotation

Cabins: 28 air-conditioned capsules, each capable of holding up to 28 passengers

Highlights:

Offers stunning panoramic views of the Marina Bay skyline, Gardens by the Bay, and even parts of Malaysia and Indonesia on clear days.

A popular spot for both tourists and locals, especially during sunset and nighttime when the city lights up.

Special experiences available, like dining in the capsule or booking private capsules for celebrations.

Ticket Information:

Ticket prices vary based on the experience and package. You can book tickets online or on-site.

text.text: Good experience to see the Singapore city from it. 30 minutes ride from start to stop. Cabin is comfortable with bench which can accommodate up to 16 people. Worth for the tourist to visit.
